exam_papers.title: 2025年6月大学英语四级考试真题（二）
exam_papers.description: 2025年6月大学英语四级考试真题（第二套），包含写作、听力、阅读理解和翻译四个部分

exam_sections.directions: Suppose your university is conducting a survey to collect students' opinions on the appropriate use of AI technology in assisting learning. You are now to write an essay to express your view. You will have 30 minutes to write the essay. You should write at least 120 words but no more than 180 words.

In this section, you will hear three news reports. At the end of each news report, you will hear two or three questions. Both the news report and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, you will hear two long conversations. At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions. Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, you will hear three passages. At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions. Both the passage and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, there is a passage with ten blanks. You are required to select one word for each blank from a list of choices given in a word bank following the passage. Read the passage through carefully before making your choices. Each choice in the bank is identified by a letter. Please mark the corresponding letter for each item on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre. You may not use any of the words in the bank more than once.
exam_sections.passage_content:
Sir Alfred Hitchcock was an English movie director and producer. Famously ______ to as "The Master of Suspense", Hitchcock is one of the most influential filmmakers in the history of ______. He was an extraordinary director who entertained his audience with ______ and gripping suspense movies.

His fascination with crime began at an early age when he was ______ by his father who made him spend a few minutes inside a prison for his misconduct. Hence, his movies are ______ of the guilt and innocence of the wrongdoer and the victim. He had a gift for creating stories that consisted of deceit, robbery, murder, corruption, and other criminal ______ with incredible plot twists in the storyline. The principal characters in his movies were often ordinary people ______ in unwanted and unavoidable situations.

He was ______ productive and his amazing body of work is considered fascinating by the critics. Most of his movies have ______ the test of time and are considered to be masterpieces. He is also remembered by other filmmakers, for he continues to inspire them to be passionate about their work. He is also ______ by people around the world for his entertaining and exciting stories.

exam_sections.directions: In this section, you are going to read a passage with ten statements attached to it. Each statement contains information given in one of the paragraphs. Identify the paragraph from which the information is derived. You may choose a paragraph more than once. Each paragraph is marked with a letter. Answer the questions by marking the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2.
exam_sections.passage_content:
A) Freshly juiced fruit has become a basic dietary item — especially for busy, health-conscious consumers who can save time on making (and perhaps even chewing) their food without missing out on nutrients. Fruit juice also has been linked to claims that it can help you both lose weight and stay healthy. All of which, of course, has made it highly profitable. The global fruit and vegetable juices market was valued at $154 billion in 2016 and is expected to grow.

B) But is juicing really as healthy as we think? Most foods containing fructose—a naturally occurring sugar found in all fruits and fruit juices — don't seem to have harmful effects as long as they're not contributing to excess daily calories. This is because the fibre found in whole fruits is intact, and the sugar is contained within the fruit's cells. It takes our digestive system a while to break these cells down and for fructose to enter the bloodstream.

C) But this is not the case with fruit juice. Unlike whole fruit, fruit juice has most of the fibre removed. This is why the fructose in fruit juices counts as 'free sugars' — which also include honey and the sugars added to foods. It's recommended by the World Health Organisation that adults have no more than 30g of added sugar, the equivalent of 150ml of fruit juice, per day. The problem is that, with the fibre removed, fruit juice's fructose is absorbed more quickly. Sudden increases in blood sugar cause the release of insulin to bring it back down to a stable level. Over time, this mechanism can wear out increasing the risk of developing type 2 diabetes. In 2013, researchers analysed the health data of 100,000 people collected between 1986 and 2009 and found that fruit juice consumption was linked with increased risk of type 2 diabetes. Another study found a relationship between fruit juice and type 2 diabetes after following the diets and diabetes status of more than 70,000 nurses over 18 years. The researchers explain that the possible reason for this may partly have been the lack of the other components found in whole fruit, like fibre.

D) Juices containing vegetables can provide more nutrients and less sugar than juices made up of just fruit — but they still lack valuable fibre. Diets high in fibre have been linked to a lower risk of developing heart disease, stroke, high blood pressure and diabetes, and it's recommended adults consume 30g per day.

E) Aside from the link to type 2 diabetes, many studies agree that fruit juice is harmful if it contributes to an excess in calories. In an analysis of 155 studies, John Sievenpiper, associate professor at the University of Toronto's Department of Nutritional Sciences, set out to understand if the associations between sugary soft drinks and health — including risk of diabetes and heart disease — were applicable to the food and drink we generally consume as part of a healthy diet. He compared studies looking into the effects of fructose-containing sugars with control diets free from or lower in these sugars. His aim? To isolate the effects of consuming too many calories from the effects of foods containing different sugars.

F) He found negative effects on blood sugar and insulin levels when food provided excess calories from sugars, including fruit juice. However, when the calories weren't in excess overall, there were some advantages to consuming whole fruit — and even fruit juice. Sievenpiper concludes that the recommended 150ml of fruit juice per day, which is an average serving, is reasonable. The paper concluded that foods containing fructose may have some small benefits for long-term blood sugar control when they don't lead to over-consumption of calories. But when they do lead to too many calories, they risk raising blood sugar and insulin levels.

G) So while we know that fruit juice can cause diabetes if it's part of a diet that has more calories overall, it's less clear how juice affects the long-term health of those who aren't overweight. But we have a higher risk of consuming more than the recommended daily number of calories (around 2,000 for women and 2,500 for men) on the days we drink juice, according to research. Numerous studies have shown that drinking fruit juice doesn't make us consume any less of other foods throughout the day.

H) As it is easy to consume large amounts of fruit juice quite quickly, extra calories are taken in. And extra calories can contribute to weight gain. One way we can improve the effects of fruit juice on our health is making sure we select ripe fruit to retain as much of its goodness as possible, according to Roger Clemens, professor of pharmaceutical sciences at the University of Southern California.

I) Another reason for fruit juice's recent popularity is the argument that it can help to remove poisonous or harmful substances from the body. However, "the whole concept of a juice diet helping to remove poisonous or harmful substances from the body is completely false," says Clemens. "We consume compounds every day that may be poisonous and our bodies do a wonderful job of removing and eliminating anything harmful from our bodies."

J) And juice isn't a cure-all for getting your nutrients, either. "There are a lot of nutrients contained in the parts of the fruits, such as in apple skins, that are excluded when you juice them," says Heather Ferris, a professor of medicine. "You end up with sugary water with some vitamins."

K) Plus, she adds, it's not an ideal way to reach the advised 'five a day'. "People try to get five servings of fruit and vegetables per day and don't realise this isn't just about getting vitamins," she says. "It's also about reducing the amount of grain carbs and protein and fats in our diet, and increasing fibre." So while fruit juice is better than no fruit at all, there are limits. It particularly comes with risks when we consume more than 150ml of free sugars per day, or when it puts us over our recommended calorie intake. It provides us with vitamins — but fruit juice is far from a quick fix.
exam_sections.passage_title: Is juicing actually good for you?

exam_sections.directions: There are 2 passages in this section. Each passage is followed by some questions or unfinished statements. For each of them there are four choices marked A), B), C) and D). You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre.
exam_sections.passage_content:
Passage One

We all take a little extra effort to look nice for special occasions. But most of us have conflicting feelings about dressing up and feel guilty about taking the time to focus on clothes. Science now suggests the right dress may give ourselves the extra edge in our professional and personal lives.

We hear sayings like "dress for the job you want, not the job you have". Most people don't really believe in them, but research into the impact of clothes on behavior now suggests that there may actually be a grain of truth in these sayings. Science says that the clothes we wear affect our behavior, our mood and even the way we interact with others because of the symbolic meaning that we assign to different types of clothing.

We consider some clothes to be powerful some to be fun, and so on. We even evaluate people whom we have just met based on their clothes. We also evaluate ourselves based on what we are wearing because of the way they make us feel. This means that the experience of wearing something affects our attitudes and our choice of behavior.

There's a reason tailored jackets are associated with being "dressed for success". It seems that wearing formal office wear puts us in the right frame of mind to conduct business. Wearing power clothing makes us feel more confident and even increases hormones needed for displaying dominance. This in turn helps us become better negotiators and abstract thinkers.

While a good suit works wonders for our performance in the boardroom, wearing formal wear isn't a great idea when we want to socialize. Studies have found that people tend to be less open and less able to relax when they wear formal clothes.

On the other hand, a casual dress helps us become more friendly and creative. These findings support the idea of wearing business casuals on a Friday, since colleagues are most likely to take out time to socialize on the last work day of the week. I mean, who wants to hang out with people in their suits?

Passage Two

With the rise of pop music, jazz, and electronic music, both opera and classical music started to fade away from the public eye. Some people are beginning to wonder whether opera and classical music are still relevant to the modern world of music. Granted, you will not typically see today's teenagers lending their ears to Bach anytime soon, but there are some major indicators that both opera and classical music are now still quite alive.

The most major indicator of classical music's importance in society today is the fact that much of the popular music that is currently being produced uses similar beats, harmonies, and melodies as those that were used in some of classical music's best works. Even so, it can be difficult for those who do not study music theory to see this as an indicator, since it is subtle and just shows the impact symphonic orchestras have had on society's taste in music.

A better example for the relevance of opera and classical music can be seen in the invention of the rock opera. Opera, in its simplest definition, is telling a story using music as its form. The art of telling a story using music has not faded in the least bit. In fact, sometimes actual orchestras are used for major parts of the opera itself. Some of the world's greatest hits have been parts of rock operas.

Fans of classical music can also tell you that there are few types of music that are more expressive. So, it should come as no surprise to anyone that classical music pieces are still used as background music in modern movies. Symphonic orchestra compositions have also been created solely for the purpose of being included in major motion pictures. These are often very well received amongst mainstream music fans.

Classical music and opera are the very foundation of what our modern music is based upon. Considering the huge impact they have had on our current society, it is without doubt that we can expect them to continue to remain important for centuries to come.

exam_sections.directions: For this part, you are allowed 30 minutes to translate a passage from Chinese into English. You should write your answer on Answer Sheet 2.
exam_sections.translation_content: 近年来，中国东北地区正在大力开发冰雪资源。例如，哈尔滨利用丰富的冰雪资源打造了极具地方特色的"冰雪大世界"，让游客在欣赏冰雪之美的同时也能体验当地独特的民俗文化。如今，曾令人畏惧的冰天雪地正吸引着四面八方的游客，成为深受欢迎的旅游胜地。冰雪旅游业正为当地的经济发展做出越来越大的贡献。
exam_sections.translation_requirements: 请将以下中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法正确和表达流畅

exam_questions.question_text: Write an essay to express your view on the appropriate use of AI technology in assisting learning.
exam_questions.analysis: 写作题目，需要学生就适当使用人工智能技术辅助学习这一话题发表自己的看法
exam_questions.explanation: 考查学生的议论文写作能力，包括观点阐述、论证支持和结论总结

exam_questions.question_text: What does the news report say about Vaclav Bursa and Joanna Stephens?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They are young teenagers from Atlanta.", "B) They won this year's 7 Mile Bridge Run.", "C) They completed the race in less than 40 minutes.", "D) They are both students at Marathon High School."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻开头提到，周六，在一年的七英里大桥赛跑中，一名佛罗里达州青少年和一名亚特兰大女子分别赢得了男子组和女子组的冠军，故选项B为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'A Florida teenager and an Atlanta woman won the overall men's and women's divisions Saturday at the annual 7 Mile Bridge Run.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about the April contest?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It drew competitors from more than 40 countries.", "B) It is watched live online by fans all over the world.", "C) It closed the city of Big Pine Key to traffic for three hours.", "D) It is one of the most popular running events in the southeastern U.S."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻结尾部分提到，四月的这场比赛是美国东南部最受欢迎的跑步赛事之一，故选项D为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'The April contest is one of the most popular running events in the southeastern United States.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn from the news report about Tim Peake?
exam_questions.options: ["A) He was once a full-time ambassador.", "B) He was soon to retire from the army.", "C) He became an astronaut in 2015.", "D) He used to be a helicopter pilot."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻中间部分提到，这位英国陆军航空兵团前直升机飞行员于2009年被选为欧洲宇航局的宇航员。由此可知，选项D为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'The former British Army Air Corps helicopter pilot was selected as a European Space Agency astronaut in 2009.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does Tim Peake say about his work with the European Space Agency?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It has been unbelievably exciting and rewarding.", "B) It has been extraordinarily tough and demanding.", "C) It has contributed a great deal to human flights to space.", "D) It has given him exceptional privilege as an ambassador."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻后半部分蒂姆评价自己在欧洲宇航局13年的工作时说，这是一段极其令人振奋且有意义的经历。由此可知，选项A为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'It has been incredibly exciting and rewarding.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about the five cats seen in the Asda store?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They are known for their loyalty to their owners.", "B) They are brought in by the store's customers.", "C) They are regular visitors to the store.", "D) They are pets kept by the store staff."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻开头就提到，威尔士的一家阿斯达超市如今成了五只猫的家。新闻末尾部分也提到，现在至少有五只不同的猫几乎每天都来超市，非常频繁地光顾超市。由此可知，选项C为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'An Asda store in Wales is now home to five cats after they wandered in and made themselves comfortable.' 和 'There are now at least five different cats who come almost on a daily basis.'

exam_questions.question_text: What did some customers think when they saw the first cat routinely appear in the store?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It might be a nuisance to the loyal shoppers.", "B) It might have been abandoned by its owner.", "C) It might be 12 months old.", "D) It might have got lost."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻中提到，12个月前，有一只猫开始定期光顾这家超市，一头雾水的顾客在脸书群组中发帖，试图弄清楚这只猫是否迷路了。由此可知，选项D为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'Local newspapers reported that puzzled customers posted on Facebook groups to try to find out if the cat was lost.'

exam_questions.question_text: What are customers asked not to do?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Feed the cats.", "B) Remove any store signs.", "C) Sit in the shop aisles.", "D) Bring in pets with them."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。新闻末尾提到，五只猫每天都来超市，如此频繁地光顾超市，以至于员工们不得不张贴告示，要求顾客们不要投喂它们。故选项A为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 新闻中提到：'staff have been forced to put up signs, asking their customers not to feed them.'

exam_questions.question_text: What has the woman been thinking of doing next semester?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Sharing her room with friends.", "B) Cutting down her living expenses.", "C) Living off campus.", "D) Moving to the city center."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。在对话开头，女士就开门见山地提出自己一直在考虑下学期搬出校园居住，所以答案是C项。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话开头：'I've been thinking about moving off campus next semester.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the man suggest the woman take into consideration?
exam_questions.options: ["A) The facilities available.", "B) Various costs involved.", "C) Changes in living conditions.", "D) The distance to her home."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中，男士听说女士打算搬出校园居住后他提到了费用问题，说不确定自己和女士的妈妈能否负担得起，后面又明确提到大城市的房租很高，还有电费和煤气费，问女士是否把这些因素都考虑在内。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'And then there's the expense, too. I'm not sure we can afford it.' 和 'Rents in big cities are high, and then there's the cost of electricity and gas. Have you factored those in?'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the woman say she did during high school?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Went through much trouble.", "B) Commuted to save money.", "C) Studied on the bus.", "D) Lived on campus."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中，当男士提出担心女士每天会浪费好几个小时在通勤路上而无法学习时，女士回应说她到学校大约需要一个小时，但她完全可以在公交车上学习，毕竟高中时她就这样做过。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'It's about an hour to campus, but there's no reason I can't study on the bus. After all, I did that during high school and my commute was even longer then.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the man say he'll do at the end of the conversation?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Discuss the matter with the woman's mother.", "B) Make a decision within a few days.", "C) Try his best to persuade his wife.", "D) Weigh the benefits against the disadvantages."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。在对话结尾，男士提到自己不觉得（女士住在校外）利大于弊，但他会和女士的妈妈商量一下这件事。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'I'm not convinced that the benefits are greater than the disadvantages, but I'll discuss this with your mother.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is the woman doing?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Interviewing the man.", "B) Looking for Lawrence.", "C) Choosing a present for her nephew.", "D) Helping the man with his shopping."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话开头女士明确表示她要给侄子劳伦斯挑礼物，然后请男士推荐玩具，并最终选定了一款。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话开头：'I'm looking for a present for my nephew, Lawrence.'

exam_questions.question_text: How does the man describe Bobo Man, the action figure?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Quite educational.", "B) Incredibly popular.", "C) Driven by batteries.", "D) Obviously childish."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中，男士提到，对于十岁左右的男孩来说，今年最畅销的是一款叫做波波侠的动作玩偶，特别受欢迎。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'For that age group, our biggest seller this year has been this action figure. It's called Bobo Man, and it's incredibly popular.'

exam_questions.question_text: What kind of game does the woman think would be good for Lawrence?
exam_questions.options: ["A) One he loves for helping exercise his mind.", "B) One he can play together with his sister.", "C) One he finds interesting and challenging.", "D) One he can play either alone or in a group."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中，女士提到劳伦斯有个姐姐，年纪比他稍大一点，所以也许一款他们可以一起玩的游戏会很好。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'Lawrence has a sister who is slightly older, so maybe a game that they can play together would be good.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn from the conversation about the game Battleships?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It has been enjoyed by kids for decades.", "B) It always reminds people of times of war.", "C) It has been played both indoors and outdoors.", "D) It distinguishes itself as one of the oldest games."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中，男士向女士推荐海战棋游戏时提到它是一款经典游戏，从上世纪30年代就有了，女士回应说他们小时候就有一款，男士接着说每个人都有过这款游戏，而且现在的孩子和他们小时候一样喜欢它。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'It's a total classic. It has been around since the 1930s.' 和 'And kids enjoy it just as much today as you and I did when we were young.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn from the passage about the paradox of choice?
exam_questions.options: ["A) A display of a variety of products increases consumers' interest.", "B) Too many choices decrease one's desire to buy.", "C) Fewer choices lead to lower customer satisfaction.", "D) Customers given more choices are more likely to get confused."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章开头部分明确提到，人们原本认为给顾客提供更多选择，他们就会更愿意购买产品，但"选择悖论"表明，当人们面对过多的选择时，他们购买的可能性反而更低。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'But here's the paradox of choice: if a person is presented with too many choices, they are actually less likely to buy.'

exam_questions.question_text: What did the psychologists want to find out in their 2012 study about jams?
exam_questions.options: ["A) What kind of display results in more sales.", "B) What kind of display creates more interest.", "C) What kind of display attracts a greater crowd of customers.", "D) What kind of display leads to greater customer satisfaction."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章中提到，心理学家在2012年关于果酱的研究中设置了展品种类数量不同的展示台（24种果酱和6种果酱），目的是探究哪种展示方式能带来更多销量。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'Guess which display table led to more sales?'

exam_questions.question_text: What is the finding of an extensive study published in 2015?
exam_questions.options: ["A) There are situations where customers buy nothing.", "B) There are tricks to increase customer satisfaction.", "C) There are ways to predict customer preferences.", "D) There are rules that motivate customers to buy."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章最后提到，2015年发表的大规模研究发现了四条促使消费者购买的规则。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'They found four rules that motivate consumers to buy...'

exam_questions.question_text: What do many Americans think of volunteering?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Stressful.", "B) Burdensome.", "C) Worthwhile.", "D) Energy-boosting."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中提到，一项调查显示，许多美国人认为志愿服务是值得的。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'...many Americans view volunteering as worthwhile.'

exam_questions.question_text: How could companies ensure both employees and employers benefit from volunteering?
exam_questions.options: ["A) By linking it with employees' salary.", "B) By taking it as the New Year resolution.", "C) By improving work schedules.", "D) By making it part of the job."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中间部分提到，如果公司将员工志愿服务作为工作的一部分，员工和雇主都将从中受益。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'...but employees and employers would actually benefit if companies made employee volunteering part of the job.'

exam_questions.question_text: What did 75% of employees say about volunteering in a survey?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It was very important to their well-being.", "B) It had taken little of their spare time.", "C) It was an outlet for their personal fulfillment.", "D) It helped improve their working environment."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章最后提到，在一项调查中，75%的员工表示志愿服务对他们的健康快乐至关重要。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'...75% said volunteering was critical to their well-being.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about the UK's retail sector food waste?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It amounts to 2,000 tons daily.", "B) It mostly comes from supermarkets.", "C) It is estimated at 11% of the UK's total food supply.", "D) It has a lot to do with independent luxury food suppliers."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章开头提到，英国零售业每年产生的20万吨食物浪费中，绝大部分来自超市。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'The vast majority of the UK's 200,000 tonnes of retail sectors annual food waste comes from supermarkets.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does Sophie André's business do in London?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It rents bicycles to deliver food.", "B) It sells sought-after coffee beans.", "C) It delivers luxury hand-made food.", "D) It recycles waste food from the city."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中间提到，2016年，她（索菲·安德烈）搬到伦敦，创办了一家在全城配送高端手工制作食品的公司。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'In 2016 she moved to London and began by setting up a business delivering luxury hand-made food across the city.'

exam_questions.question_text: In what way does Sophie André's business differ from many food waste projects?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It pays special attention to the size and shape of its products.", "B) It tries to escape the constraints of the current food system.", "C) It cooperates closely with local producers.", "D) It aims to provide high-quality products."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章中提到，与近年来涌现出的许多食物浪费处理项目不同，安德烈的想法不只是重新分配废弃食品，而是要提供高质量的产品。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'...the idea is not simply to redistribute waste food, but to provide a high-quality product.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why will suppliers always have a certain amount of surplus?
exam_questions.options: ["A) To ensure a regular supply.", "B) To maintain a unique menu.", "C) To make up for the waste products.", "D) To meet customers' urgent demand."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。文章最后提到，或许与其他废弃食品不同，这些食品的供应很稳定，供应商总会有一定数量的盈余食品，所以菜单也能保持稳定。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'Perhaps unlike other waste food, the supply is regular. Suppliers will always have a certain amount of surplus. So the menus remain regular too.'

exam_questions.options: ["A) caught", "B) cinema", "C) engaging", "D) graphically", "E) highly", "F) incentive", "G) instincts", "H) offences", "I) punished", "J) referred", "K) stood", "L) symbolic", "M) tuned", "N) tiny", "O) worshipped"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格位于句子的状语结构中，逻辑主语与主句主语一致，为被动关系。空格前面为副词Famously，后面为to as…，空格处应填过去分词。(be) referred to as为固定搭配，意为"被称为……"。
exam_questions.explanation: 根据上下文，希区柯克被誉为"悬疑大师"，故答案为referred。

exam_questions.options: ["A) caught", "B) cinema", "C) engaging", "D) graphically", "E) highly", "F) incentive", "G) instincts", "H) offences", "I) punished", "J) referred", "K) stood", "L) symbolic", "M) tuned", "N) tiny", "O) worshipped"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格位于句末，前面为in the history of，故空格处应填名词。从前文的movie director（电影导演）、filmmakers（电影制作人），以及后文的suspense movies（悬疑电影）可推断，上下文与电影领域有关。
exam_questions.explanation: cinema表示电影业，符合语境。

exam_questions.options: ["A) caught", "B) cinema", "C) engaging", "D) graphically", "E) highly", "F) incentive", "G) instincts", "H) offences", "I) punished", "J) referred", "K) stood", "L) symbolic", "M) tuned", "N) tiny", "O) worshipped"]
exam_questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格前面为entertained his audience with，后面为and gripping suspense movies，and连接并列成分，gripping为形容词，故空格处应填形容词，与gripping共同修饰suspense movies。engaging意为"引人入胜的"，符合语境。
exam_questions.explanation: engaging表示引人入胜的，与gripping（扣人心弦的）共同描述电影特点。

exam_questions.options: ["A) caught", "B) cinema", "C) engaging", "D) graphically", "E) highly", "F) incentive", "G) instincts", "H) offences", "I) punished", "J) referred", "K) stood", "L) symbolic", "M) tuned", "N) tiny", "O) worshipped"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前面为he was，后面为动作执行者by his father，空格处需填入动词的过去分词形式，构成完整的被动语态。句中提到他行为不端，父亲让他在监狱里待了几分钟，由此可知，父亲为了"惩罚"他才让他在监狱里待了几分钟。
exam_questions.explanation: punished表示惩罚，符合语境。

exam_questions.options: ["A) caught", "B) cinema", "C) engaging", "D) graphically", "E) highly", "F) incentive", "G) instincts", "H) offences", "I) punished", "J) referred", "K) stood", "L) symbolic", "M) tuned", "N) tiny", "O) worshipped"]
exam_questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格前面为系动词are，后面为介词短语of the guilt...，空格处应填形容词。前一句提到导演童年时被惩罚的经历，hence（因此）引出结果，即童年经历影响了电影的主题。
exam_questions.explanation: symbolic表示象征的，be symbolic of为固定搭配，意为"象征……"。

exam_questions.options: ["A) caught", "B) cinema", "C) engaging", "D) graphically", "E) highly", "F) incentive", "G) instincts", "H) offences", "I) punished", "J) referred", "K) stood", "L) symbolic", "M) tuned", "N) tiny", "O) worshipped"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格前面为形容词criminal，后面为介词短语with incredible plot...，故空格处应填名词。and other表明空格所填名词与前面列举的犯罪行为并列。
exam_questions.explanation: offences表示违法行为，criminal offences表示"刑事犯罪"，能概括前面的具体罪行。

exam_questions.options: ["A) caught", "B) cinema", "C) engaging", "D) graphically", "E) highly", "F) incentive", "G) instincts", "H) offences", "I) punished", "J) referred", "K) stood", "L) symbolic", "M) tuned", "N) tiny", "O) worshipped"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前面为ordinary people，后面为in unwanted and...，空格处应填过去分词，作后置定语，修饰people。ordinary people（普通人）与unwanted and unavoidable situations（身不由己之境）二者为人"陷入"身不由己之境的关系。
exam_questions.explanation: caught表示陷入，(be) caught in意为"陷入"，符合语境。

exam_questions.options: ["A) caught", "B) cinema", "C) engaging", "D) graphically", "E) highly", "F) incentive", "G) instincts", "H) offences", "I) punished", "J) referred", "K) stood", "L) symbolic", "M) tuned", "N) tiny", "O) worshipped"]
exam_questions.analysis: 副词辨析题。空格所在句子主系表结构完整，前面为系动词was，后面为形容词productive，故空格处应填副词，修饰后面的形容词。由空格后的productive（高产的）以及his amazing body of work（其令人惊叹的作品体系）可知，此处是说希区柯克十分高产。
exam_questions.explanation: highly表示"非常，极"，符合语境。

exam_questions.options: ["A) caught", "B) cinema", "C) engaging", "D) graphically", "E) highly", "F) incentive", "G) instincts", "H) offences", "I) punished", "J) referred", "K) stood", "L) symbolic", "M) tuned", "N) tiny", "O) worshipped"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格所在句为现在完成时，前面为助动词have，后面为名词短语the test of time and...，故空格处应填过去分词，构成完成时态。由下文与"have 34 the test of time"构成并列关系的and are considered to be masterpiece（被视为杰作）可知，此处是作者高度评价希区柯克的电影，杰作自然能"经受住"时间的考验。
exam_questions.explanation: stood表示经受，stand the test of time为固定短语，意为"经受时间的考验"。

exam_questions.options: ["A) caught", "B) cinema", "C) engaging", "D) graphically", "E) highly", "F) incentive", "G) instincts", "H) offences", "I) punished", "J) referred", "K) stood", "L) symbolic", "M) tuned", "N) tiny", "O) worshipped"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前面为He is also，后面为动作执行者by people，空格处需填入动词的过去分词形式，构成完整的被动语态。前文提到"其他电影制作人也对他缅怀不已，因为他始终激励着后来者以热忱投身创作"，而空格所在句承接上文，且使用了also一词，可知此处作者仍在正面评价希区柯克，突出其影响力。
exam_questions.explanation: worshipped表示崇拜、崇敬，符合语境。

exam_questions.question_text: Fruit juice is different from whole fruit in that it contains much less fibre.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，与整个水果不同，果汁中的大部分纤维已被去除。题干与该句内容同义，其中Fruit juice属于原词重现，different from whole fruit对应原文中的Unlike whole fruit，contains much less fibre与原文中的has most of the fibre removed同义。
exam_questions.explanation: C段第二句：'Unlike whole fruit, fruit juice has most of the fibre removed.'

exam_questions.question_text: Some people believe a juice diet helps to rid our body of harmful or poisonous substances.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，果汁近来受欢迎的另一个原因是它能帮助清除体内有毒或有害物质的说法。题干与该句同义，其中Some people believe对应原文中的the argument，a juice diet属于第二句中的原词重现，helps to rid our body of harmful or poisonous substances对应原文中的help to remove poisonous or harmful substances from the body。
exam_questions.explanation: I段第一句：'Another reason for fruit juice's recent popularity is the argument that it can help to remove poisonous or harmful substances from the body.'

exam_questions.question_text: A lot of research comes to the same conclusion that fruit juice does harm to the human body when it leads to surplus calories.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，除了与2型糖尿病的关联外，许多研究一致认为，如果果汁导致热量过剩，它就是有害的。题干与这句话同义，其中A lot of research comes to the same conclusion与原文中的many studies agree that同义，fruit juice does harm to the human body对应原文中的fruit juice is harmful，when it leads to surplus calories对应原文中的if it contributes to an excess in calories。
exam_questions.explanation: E段第一句：'Aside from the link to type 2 diabetes, many studies agree that fruit juice is harmful if it contributes to an excess in calories.'

exam_questions.question_text: The claimed health benefits of fruit and vegetable juices have rendered the industry very profitable.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位段提到，当然，所有这一切使其利润十分可观，2016年，全球果蔬汁市场价值为1540亿美元，这一数字预计还将增长。而"所有这一切"指的是前文如何提到的：鲜榨果汁已经成为一种基本的饮食项目——特别是对于那些忙碌且注重健康的消费者来说；果汁还与一些减肥和保持健康的说法相关联。故题干是对该段内容的概括总结。
exam_questions.explanation: A段最后两句：'All of which, of course, has made it highly profitable. The global fruit and vegetable juices market was valued at $154 billion in 2016 and is expected to grow.'

exam_questions.question_text: To increase the benefits of fruit juice to our health, we'd better choose ripe fruit to make juice.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，一种办法是，我们可以通过确保选择成熟的水果来榨汁，以保留尽可能多的营养价值，从而改善果汁对健康的影响。题干是对这句话的概括。
exam_questions.explanation: H段最后一句：'One way we can improve the effects of fruit juice on our health is making sure we select ripe fruit to retain as much of its goodness as possible...'

exam_questions.question_text: Diets containing large amounts of fibre reduce the risk of heart disease, diabetes and other health hazards.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，高纤维饮食与降低患心脏病、中风、高血压和糖尿病的风险存在关联。题干与该句属于同义表述。
exam_questions.explanation: D段第二句：'Diets high in fibre have been linked to a lower risk of developing heart disease, stroke, high blood pressure and diabetes...'

exam_questions.question_text: According to a research paper, drinking fruit juice is beneficial on condition that it is consumed in reasonable amounts.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。定位段提到，如果总热量摄入不超标，食用整个水果，甚至是果汁，还是有一些益处的。西文皮珀得出结论：每天推荐的150毫升果汁是合理的。该论文得出结论：含有果糖的食物在不导致热量摄入过度的情况下，对长期血糖控制可能有一些小的益处。题干是对这几句内容的概括。
exam_questions.explanation: F段第二至四句：'However, when the calories weren't in excess overall, there were some advantages to consuming whole fruit — and even fruit juice. Sievenpiper concludes that the recommended 150ml of fruit juice per day, which is an average serving, is reasonable. The paper concluded that foods containing fructose may have some small benefits for long-term blood sugar control when they don't lead to over-consumption of calories.'

exam_questions.question_text: One expert claims that juicing wastes a lot of nutrients contained in fruits.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，"水果的某些部分，如苹果皮中，含有很多营养物质，而这些部分在榨汁时会被过滤掉。"医学教授希瑟·费里斯说。题干与这句话同义。
exam_questions.explanation: J段第二句：'"There are a lot of nutrients contained in the parts of the fruits, such as in apple skins, that are excluded when you juice them," says Heather Ferris, a professor of medicine.'

exam_questions.question_text: It takes some time for fruit's cells to be digested and for fructose to be absorbed.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，我们的消化系统需要一些时间来分解这些细胞，然后果糖才会进入血液中。"这些细胞"指的就是前一句中提到的"水果的细胞"，故题干与该句同义。
exam_questions.explanation: B段最后一句：'It takes our digestive system a while to break these cells down and for fructose to enter the bloodstream.'

exam_questions.question_text: A lot of research has demonstrated that drinking fruit juice does not reduce our daily consumption of other foods.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。定位句提到，大量的研究已经表明，喝果汁不会减少全天其他食物的摄入量。题干与该句属于同义转述。
exam_questions.explanation: G段最后一句：'Numerous studies have shown that drinking fruit juice doesn't make us consume any less of other foods throughout the day.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does science suggest the right dress may do?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Add to our advantage in work and life.", "B) Enable us to look a lot more attractive.", "C) Help us to enjoy a fuller personal life.", "D) Provide extra energy for what we do."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第一段最后一句指出，现在的科学表明，合适的着装可能会给我们的职业和个人生活提供额外的优势，故选项A正确。
exam_questions.explanation: 第一段最后一句：'Science now suggests the right dress may give ourselves the extra edge in our professional and personal lives.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why does science say the clothes one wears may affect their interaction with others?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Clothes usually represent one's social and economic status.", "B) Clothes largely determine one's likability by people around.", "C) Different types of clothing markedly reflect different personalities.", "D) Different types of clothing convey different messages symbolically."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第二段第三句话指出，科学表明，我们的着装会影响我们的行为、情绪，甚至与他人交往的方式，因为我们赋予了不同类型的服装象征性的意义，这说明服装的象征意义影响穿着者与他人的交往。
exam_questions.explanation: 第二段第三句：'Science says that the clothes we wear affect our behavior, our mood and even the way we interact with others because of the symbolic meaning that we assign to different types of clothing.'

exam_questions.question_text: How do the clothes we wear sway our evaluation of ourselves?
exam_questions.options: ["A) By exerting an effect on our power of judgment.", "B) By impacting how we feel about ourselves.", "C) By affecting what we take as the basis for assessment.", "D) By influencing our interpretation of symbolic messages."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第三段第三句指出，我们也会根据自己的穿着来评价自己，因为它们会影响我们的感觉。
exam_questions.explanation: 第三段第三句：'We also evaluate ourselves based on what we are wearing because of the way they make us feel.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why does the author say tailored jackets are associated with being "dressed for success"?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They are necessary for formal business dealings.", "B) They may help people concentrate on their business.", "C) They are vital to keeping a dominant position in business transactions.", "D) They may enable people to have the right mentality for doing business."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第四段第一句指出，定制夹克与"为成功着装"联系在一起是有原因的。然后在第二句表明原因，穿着正式的职业装似乎能让我们以正确心态开展业务。
exam_questions.explanation: 第四段第一、二句：'There's a reason tailored jackets are associated with being "dressed for success". It seems that wearing formal office wear puts us in the right frame of mind to conduct business.'

exam_questions.question_text: What are people advised to do when they want to socialize?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Focus on clothing.", "B) Wear a good suit.", "C) Dress casually.", "D) Look unusual."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。第五段第一句指出，但当我们想要社交时，穿正装并不是一个好主意。第六段第一句指出，休闲装能让我们变得更友好、更具创造力。
exam_questions.explanation: 第五段第一句：'While a good suit works wonders for our performance in the boardroom, wearing formal wear isn't a great idea when we want to socialize.' 和第六段第一句：'On the other hand, a casual dress helps us become more friendly and creative.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author think of classical music and opera in today's world?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They still make their presence felt.", "B) They have given way to electronic music.", "C) They will not fade away from the public eye.", "D) They are no longer relevant to teenagers' lives."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第一段最后一句指出，你通常不会看到今天的青少年很快地去聆听巴赫的作品，但有一些重大的迹象表明，歌剧和古典音乐至今仍然充满活力。
exam_questions.explanation: 第一段最后一句：'...but there are some major indicators that both opera and classical music are now still quite alive.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about much of the popular music currently produced?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It can be difficult for many classical music fans to appreciate.", "B) It can be seen as an indicator of refinement on classical music.", "C) It caters to society's taste in music in a more subtle way than classical music.", "D) It contains elements similar to those in some masterpieces of classical music."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第二段第一句指出，古典音乐在当今社会中仍具有重要性的主要标志是，目前制作的许多流行音乐都使用了与古典音乐中一些最佳作品相似的节拍、和声和旋律。
exam_questions.explanation: 第二段第一句：'The most major indicator of classical music's importance in society today is the fact that much of the popular music that is currently being produced uses similar beats, harmonies, and melodies as those that were used in some of classical music's best works.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why does the author mention the invention of the rock opera?
exam_questions.options: ["A) To illustrate how to tell a story using music.", "B) To present the simplest definition of opera.", "C) To show the relevance of opera and classical music.", "D) To justify the necessity of using orchestras in opera."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第三段第一句指出，关于歌剧和古典音乐重要性的一个更好的例子是摇滚歌剧的发明。
exam_questions.explanation: 第三段第一句：'A better example for the relevance of opera and classical music can be seen in the invention of the rock opera.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why are classical music pieces still used as background music in modern movies?
exam_questions.options: ["A) There are few types of music for movie producers to choose from.", "B) They are considered to be the most expressive type of music.", "C) They are well received by movie fans from all over the world.", "D) They are essential for movies to become the world's greatest hits."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。第四段前两句指出，古典音乐爱好者也可以告诉你，几乎没有比古典音乐更具表现力的音乐类型了，因此，古典音乐作品仍被用作现代电影的背景音乐也就不足为奇了。
exam_questions.explanation: 第四段第一、二句：'Fans of classical music can also tell you that there are few types of music that are more expressive. So, it should come as no surprise to anyone that classical music pieces are still used as background music in modern movies.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about our modern music?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It could not have come into being without classical music and opera as its foundation.", "B) It cannot outcompete classical music and opera in its impact on our current society.", "C) It will not enjoy as much popularity as classical music and opera among music fans.", "D) It might not be able to rival classical music and opera in importance for centuries to come."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。最后一段首句指出，古典音乐和歌剧正是现代音乐的基础。
exam_questions.explanation: 最后一段首句：'Classical music and opera are the very foundation of what our modern music is based upon.'

exam_questions.question_text: Translate the Chinese passage into English.
exam_questions.correct_answer: In recent years, Northeast China has been vigorously developing its ice and snow resources. For instance, Harbin has created the highly distinctive "Ice and Snow World" by leveraging its abundant ice and snow resources, allowing visitors to appreciate the beauty of ice and snow while experiencing the region's unique folk culture. What was once an intimidating frozen landscape is now attracting tourists from all directions, becoming a highly popular tourist destination. The ice and snow tourism industry is making an increasingly significant contribution to local economic development.
exam_questions.analysis: 翻译题目，需要学生将中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法、词汇和句式结构的正确性
exam_questions.explanation: 考查学生的汉译英能力，包括词汇选择、语法结构、句式转换和语言表达的准确性
